Affine Space - Point vs. Vector

  • ê°œë…ì ìœ¼ë¡œ pointì™€ vectorëŠ” ë§¤ìš° ë‹¤ë¦„
  • ì´ ì°¨ì´ëŠ” homogeneous coordinatesë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ
  • ì´ ê°•ì˜ì—ì„œëŠ” affine space, pointì™€ vectorì˜ ì°¨ì´ì , ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  ê·¸ê²ƒì´ homogeneous coordinatesì™€ ì–´ë–»ê²Œ ì—°ê²°ë˜ëŠ”ì§€ë¥¼ í•™ìŠµí•¨
  • ì´ ê°œë…ì€ coordinate invariant ë˜ëŠ” coordinate-free geometric programmingì´ë¼ê³ ë„ ë¶ˆë¦¼

(ì¶œì²˜: http://mrl.snu.ac.kr/courses/CourseGraphics/index_2017spring.html)

Points

  • Point p\mathbf{p}p, Point q\mathbf{q}q
  • ì´ ë‘ ì ì„ ë”í•œ "sum"ì€ ë¬´ì—‡ì¸ê°€?

If you assume coordinates, â€¦

  • p=(x1,Â y1)\mathbf{p} = (x_1,~y_1)p=(x1â€‹,Â y1â€‹)
  • q=(x2,Â y2)\mathbf{q} = (x_2,~y_2)q=(x2â€‹,Â y2â€‹)
  • í•©: (x1+x2,Â y1+y2)(x_1+x_2,~y_1+y_2)(x1â€‹+x2â€‹,Â y1â€‹+y2â€‹)
    • ì´ê²Œ ë§ëŠ”ê°€?
    • ê¸°í•˜í•™ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì˜ë¯¸ê°€ ìˆëŠ”ê°€?
  • ë™ì¼í•œ ì¢Œí‘œ í‘œí˜„ì—ì„œ,
  • p=(x1,Â y1)\mathbf{p} = (x_1,~y_1)p=(x1â€‹,Â y1â€‹)

    ì›ì ì—ì„œ p\mathbf{p}pì™€ q\mathbf{q}qê¹Œì§€ ê°€ëŠ” vectorì˜ í•©ìœ¼ë¡œ ê°„ì£¼í•´ì•¼ í•¨
    â†’ Vector sum

If you select a different origin, â€¦

  • p=(x1,Â y1)\mathbf{p} = (x_1,~y_1)p=(x1â€‹,Â y1â€‹)

    ì¢Œí‘œê³„(ì›ì )ê°€ ì–´ë””ì¸ì§€ì— ë”°ë¼ ë‹¬ë¼ì§

Points and Vectors

  • pointëŠ” ì¢Œí‘œê°’ìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ì˜ëœ ìœ„ì¹˜

  • í•˜ì§€ë§Œ coordinate-free ê´€ì ì—ì„œëŠ” pointëŠ” vectorê°€ ì•„ë‹˜

Points & Vectors are Different!

  • ìˆ˜í•™ì (ë˜ëŠ” ë¬¼ë¦¬ì )ìœ¼ë¡œ,
    • PointëŠ” ê³µê°„ìƒì˜ ìœ„ì¹˜

  • Vector space

  • A vector spaceëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ êµ¬ì„±ë¨:

Linear Combination

  • ë²¡í„°ë“¤ì˜ ì„ í˜• ê²°í•©(linear combination) ë˜í•œ ë²¡í„°ì„

u0,u1,â€¦,unâˆˆVâ‡’c0u0+c1u1+â‹¯+cnunâˆˆV\mathbf{u}_0, \mathbf{u}_1, \dots, \mathbf{u}_n \in V \\ \Rightarrow c_0 \mathbf{u}_0 + c_1 \mathbf{u}_1 + \dots + c_n \mathbf{u}_n \in V u0â€‹,u1â€‹,â€¦,unâ€‹âˆˆVâ‡’c0â€‹u0â€‹+c1â€‹u1â€‹+â‹¯+cnâ€‹unâ€‹âˆˆV

Affine Spaces

  • An affine spaceëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ êµ¬ì„±ë¨:
    • ì ë“¤ì˜ ì§‘í•©, ê´€ë ¨ëœ ë²¡í„° ê³µê°„

Coordinate-Free Geometric Operations

  • ë§ì…ˆ (Addition)
  • ëº„ì…ˆ (Subtraction)
  • ìŠ¤ì¹¼ë¼ ê³± (Scalar multiplication)

Addition

  • u,v,w\mathbf{u}, \mathbf{v}, \mathbf{w}u,v,w: vectors
  • p,q\mathbf{p}, \mathbf{q}p,q: points
    ë¼ê³  í•  ë•Œ,
  • u+vâ†’\mathbf{u} + \mathbf{v} \rightarrowu+vâ†’ vector
  • p+wâ†’\mathbf{p} + \mathbf{w} \rightarrowp+wâ†’ point

Subtraction

  • uâˆ’vâ†’\mathbf{u} - \mathbf{v} \rightarrowuâˆ’vâ†’ vector
  • pâˆ’qâ†’\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{q} \rightarrowpâˆ’qâ†’ vector
  • pâˆ’wâ†’\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{w} \rightarrowpâˆ’wâ†’ point

Scalar Multiplication

  • ìŠ¤ì¹¼ë¼ â‹… ë²¡í„° = ë²¡í„°
    • câ‹…vâ†’c \cdot \mathbf{v} \rightarrowcâ‹…vâ†’ vector
  • 1â‹…1 \cdot1â‹… point = point
  • 0â‹…0 \cdot0â‹… point = vector
  • câ‹…c \cdotcâ‹… point = (undefined) Â ifÂ (câ‰ 0,Â 1)~\text{if} ~(c \neq 0,~1)Â ifÂ (cî€ =0,Â 1)

Affine Frame

  • A frameì€ ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ì˜ë¨:
    • ë²¡í„°ë“¤ì˜ ì§‘í•© $ \{ \mathbf{v}_i~| ~ i = 1, \dots, N \}$
    • ê¸°ì¤€ì  o\mathbf{o}o
  • ë²¡í„°ë“¤ì˜ ì§‘í•© {vi}\{\mathbf{v}_i\}{viâ€‹}ëŠ” í•´ë‹¹ vector spaceì˜ bases
  • o\mathbf{o}oëŠ” í•´ë‹¹ frameì˜ origin
  • NNNì€ affine spaceì˜ dimension
  • ì„ì˜ì˜ ì  p\mathbf{p}pëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì´ í‘œí˜„ë¨:

p=o+c1v1+c2v2+â‹¯+cnvn\mathbf{p} = \mathbf{o} + c_1 \mathbf{v}_1 + c_2 \mathbf{v}_2 + \dots + c_n \mathbf{v}_n p=o+c1â€‹v1â€‹+c2â€‹v2â€‹+â‹¯+cnâ€‹vnâ€‹

  • ì„ì˜ì˜ ë²¡í„° v\mathbf{v}vëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì´ í‘œí˜„ë¨:

v=c1v1+c2v2+â‹¯+cnvn\mathbf{v} = c_1 \mathbf{v}_1 + c_2 \mathbf{v}_2 + \dots + c_n \mathbf{v}_n v=c1â€‹v1â€‹+c2â€‹v2â€‹+â‹¯+cnâ€‹vnâ€‹

Summary

  • Affine spaceì—ì„œ:

p+p=(undefined)pâˆ’p=vectorpÂ±v=pointvÂ±v=vectorcâ‹…v=vector1â‹…p=point0â‹…p=vectorcâ‹…p=(undefined)(câ‰ 0,1)\begin{aligned} \mathbf{p} + \mathbf{p} & = \text{(undefined)} \\ \mathbf{p} - \mathbf{p} & = \text{vector} \\ \mathbf{p} \pm \mathbf{v} & = \text{point} \\ \mathbf{v} \pm \mathbf{v} & = \text{vector} \\ c \cdot \mathbf{v} & = \text{vector} \\ 1 \cdot \mathbf{p} & = \text{point} \\ 0 \cdot \mathbf{p} & = \text{vector} \\ c \cdot \mathbf{p} & = \text{(undefined)} \quad (c \neq 0, 1) \end{aligned} p+ppâˆ’ppÂ±vvÂ±vcâ‹…v1â‹…p0â‹…pcâ‹…pâ€‹=(undefined)=vector=point=vector=vector=point=vector=(undefined)(cî€ =0,1)â€‹

Points & Vectors in Homogeneous Coordinates

  • Homogeneous coordinatesì—ì„œëŠ”,
    • 3D point: $ (x, y, z, \mathbf{1}) $
    • 3D vector: $ (x, y, z, \mathbf{0}) $

â†’\rightarrowâ†’ ì´ í‘œí˜„ì€ coordinate-free geometric programmingì˜ ê°œë…ê³¼ ì™„ì „í•˜ê²Œ ì¼ì¹˜í•˜ëŠ” ëª¨ë¸ì„ ì œê³µí•¨

ì˜ˆì‹œ:

(x1,y1,z1,1)+(x2,y2,z2,1)=(x1+x2,y1+y2,z1+z2,2)â†’pointÂ (undefined)(x_1, y_1, z_1, 1) + (x_2, y_2, z_2, 1) \\ = (x_1 + x_2, y_1 + y_2, z_1 + z_2, 2) \rightarrow \text{point (undefined)} (x1â€‹,y1â€‹,z1â€‹,1)+(x2â€‹,y2â€‹,z2â€‹,1)=(x1â€‹+x2â€‹,y1â€‹+y2â€‹,z1â€‹+z2â€‹,2)â†’pointÂ (undefined)

(x1,y1,z1,1)âˆ’(x2,y2,z2,1)=(x1âˆ’x2,y1âˆ’y2,z1âˆ’z2,0)â†’vector(x_1, y_1, z_1, 1) - (x_2, y_2, z_2, 1) \\ = (x_1 - x_2, y_1 - y_2, z_1 - z_2, 0) \rightarrow \text{vector} (x1â€‹,y1â€‹,z1â€‹,1)âˆ’(x2â€‹,y2â€‹,z2â€‹,1)=(x1â€‹âˆ’x2â€‹,y1â€‹âˆ’y2â€‹,z1â€‹âˆ’z2â€‹,0)â†’vector

(x1,y1,z1,1)+(x2,y2,z2,0)=(x1+x2,y1+y2,z1+z2,1)â†’point(x_1, y_1, z_1, 1) + (x_2, y_2, z_2, 0) \\ = (x_1 + x_2, y_1 + y_2, z_1 + z_2, 1) \rightarrow \text{point} (x1â€‹,y1â€‹,z1â€‹,1)+(x2â€‹,y2â€‹,z2â€‹,0)=(x1â€‹+x2â€‹,y1â€‹+y2â€‹,z1â€‹+z2â€‹,1)â†’point

(x1,y1,z1,0)+(x2,y2,z2,0)=(x1+x2,y1+y2,z1+z2,0)â†’vector(x_1, y_1, z_1, 0) + (x_2, y_2, z_2, 0) \\ = (x_1 + x_2, y_1 + y_2, z_1 + z_2, 0) \rightarrow \text{vector} (x1â€‹,y1â€‹,z1â€‹,0)+(x2â€‹,y2â€‹,z2â€‹,0)=(x1â€‹+x2â€‹,y1â€‹+y2â€‹,z1â€‹+z2â€‹,0)â†’vector

câ‹…(x,y,z,0)=(cx,cy,cz,0)â†’vectorc \cdot (x, y, z, 0) \\ = (cx, cy, cz, 0) \rightarrow \text{vector} câ‹…(x,y,z,0)=(cx,cy,cz,0)â†’vector

câ‹…(x,y,z,1)=(cx,cy,cz,c)â†’{pointifÂ c=1vectorifÂ c=0undefinedifÂ câ‰ 0,1c \cdot (x, y, z, 1) \\ = (cx, cy, cz, c) \rightarrow \begin{cases} \text{point} & \text{if } c = 1 \\ \text{vector} & \text{if } c = 0 \\ \text{undefined} & \text{if } c \ne 0, 1 \end{cases} câ‹…(x,y,z,1)=(cx,cy,cz,c)â†’â©â¨â§â€‹pointvectorundefinedâ€‹ifÂ c=1ifÂ c=0ifÂ cî€ =0,1â€‹

  • Affine transformation matrixì™€ point, vectorì˜ ê³±:

[Mt0T1][p1]=[Mp+t1]â†’point\begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{M} & \mathbf{t} \\ \mathbf{0}^\mathrm{T} & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{p} \\ 1 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{M} \mathbf{p} + \mathbf{t} \\ 1 \end{bmatrix} \rightarrow \text{point} [M0Tâ€‹t1â€‹][p1â€‹]=[Mp+t1â€‹]â†’point

[Mt0T1][v0]=[Mv0]â†’vector\begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{M} & \mathbf{t} \\ \mathbf{0}^\mathrm{T} & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{v} \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{M} \mathbf{v} \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} \rightarrow \text{vector} [M0Tâ€‹t1â€‹][v0â€‹]=[Mv0â€‹]â†’vector

â†’ translationì€ vectorì—ëŠ” ì ìš©ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŒ!

Quiz 1

Coordinate System & Reference Frame

  • Coordinate system

    • ì ì˜ ìœ„ì¹˜ë¥¼ ê³ ìœ í•˜ê²Œ ê²°ì •í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ í•˜ë‚˜ ì´ìƒì˜ ìˆ«ì ë˜ëŠ” ì¢Œí‘œë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ëŠ” ì²´ê³„

  • Reference frame

    • ì¶”ìƒì ì¸ ì¢Œí‘œê³„ + ì‹¤ì œ ê¸°ì¤€ì 
    • ì¢Œí‘œê³„ë¥¼ ê³ ì •ì‹œí‚¤ê¸° ìœ„í•´ ì‚¬ìš©ë¨

  • ì´ ë‘ ìš©ì–´ëŠ” ì¢…ì¢… í˜¼ìš©ë˜ì§€ë§Œ, ì˜ë¯¸ì—ëŠ” ì•½ê°„ì˜ ì°¨ì´ê°€ ìˆìŒ

World / Body Frame (or Coordinate System)

  • World frame (or coordinate system)

    • ì„¸ê³„ì— ê³ ì •ëœ ì¢Œí‘œê³„
    • aka. global frame, fixed frame

  • Body frame (or coordinate system)

    • ë¬¼ì²´ì— ê³ ì •ëœ ì¢Œí‘œê³„
    • aka. local frame

Meanings of Affine Transformation Matrix

  • í•˜ë‚˜ì˜ affine transformation matrixëŠ”
    ì—¬ëŸ¬ ê´€ì ì—ì„œ í•´ì„ ê°€ëŠ¥í•¨

1) Affine Transformation Matrix Transforms a Geometry w.r.t. World Frame

  • í–‰ë ¬ M\mathbf{M}Mì€ ê¸°í•˜ ê°ì²´ì˜ ê° vertex ìœ„ì¹˜ë¥¼ world frame ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ ìƒˆë¡œìš´ ìœ„ì¹˜ë¡œ ë³€í™˜

  • ë³€í™˜ í¬í•¨: translate, rotate, scale ë“±

M=[m11m12m13uxm21m22m23uym31m32m33uz0001]\mathbf{M} = \begin{bmatrix} m_{11} & m_{12} & m_{13} & u_x \\ m_{21} & m_{22} & m_{23} & u_y \\ m_{31} & m_{32} & m_{33} & u_z \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} M=â€‹m11â€‹m21â€‹m31â€‹0â€‹m12â€‹m22â€‹m32â€‹0â€‹m13â€‹m23â€‹m33â€‹0â€‹uxâ€‹uyâ€‹uzâ€‹1â€‹â€‹

  • M\mathbf{M}Mì„ ê³±í•˜ë©´ geometryê°€ world frameì—ì„œ ë‹¤ë¥¸ ìœ„ì¹˜ë¡œ ì´ë™ëœ ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ì–»ê²Œ ë¨

Review: Affine Frame

  • Affine frame (3D ê³µê°„ ê¸°ì¤€)ì€ ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ì˜ë¨:
    • x,Â y,Â zx,~y,~zx,Â y,Â zì¶•ì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚´ëŠ” 3ê°œì˜ ë²¡í„°
    • 1ê°œì˜ ì›ì  ìœ„ì¹˜(ì¢Œí‘œ)

World Frame

  • World frameì€ ë³´í†µ ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„ë¨:
    • í‘œì¤€ ì¶• ë²¡í„°

      e^x=[100]Â e^y=[010]Â e^z=[001]\hat{\mathbf{e}}_x = \begin{bmatrix}1 \\ 0 \\ 0\end{bmatrix}~ \hat{\mathbf{e}}_y = \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 1 \\ 0\end{bmatrix}~ \hat{\mathbf{e}}_z = \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 0 \\ 1\end{bmatrix} e^xâ€‹=â€‹100â€‹â€‹Â e^yâ€‹=â€‹010â€‹â€‹Â e^zâ€‹=â€‹001â€‹â€‹

    • ì›ì 

      0=[000]\mathbf{0}= \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 0 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} 0=â€‹000â€‹â€‹

Letâ€™s Transform a "World Frame"

  • M\mathbf{M}Mì„ world frameì— ê³±í•˜ë©´, ê° ì¶• ë²¡í„° ë° ì›ì ì´ ë³€í™˜ë¨:

x-axis:M[1000] \text{x-axis:} \quad \mathbf{M} \begin{bmatrix}1 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} x-axis:Mâ€‹1000â€‹â€‹ : ì²« ë²ˆì§¸ column

y-axis:M[0100] \text{y-axis:} \quad \mathbf{M} \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} y-axis:Mâ€‹0100â€‹â€‹ : ë‘ ë²ˆì§¸ column

z-axis:M[0010] \text{z-axis:} \quad \mathbf{M} \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} z-axis:Mâ€‹0010â€‹â€‹ : ì„¸ ë²ˆì§¸ column

origin:M[0001] \text{origin:} \quad \mathbf{M} \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 1\end{bmatrix} origin:Mâ€‹0001â€‹â€‹ : ë„¤ ë²ˆì§¸ column

2) Affine Transformation Matrix Defines an Affine Frame w.r.t. World Frame

  • í–‰ë ¬ M\mathbf{M}Mì€ ê¸°ì¤€ í”„ë ˆì„ {0}\{0\}{0} ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„ëœ body frame {1}\{1\}{1}ì„ ì •ì˜
  • M\mathbf{M}Mì˜ ê° columnì€ ë‹¤ìŒì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ëƒ„:
    • ì•ì˜ 3ê°œ column: ì¶• ë²¡í„°
    • ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ column: ì›ì  ìœ„ì¹˜

â†’ M\mathbf{M}Mì€ body frame {1}\{1\}{1}ì„ world frame {0}\{0\}{0} ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•œ ê²ƒ

Examples

  • ê°™ì€ ë¬¼ì²´ì˜ body frameì„ ë‘ ë°©ì‹ìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ì˜:
    1. world frameê³¼ ë™ì¼í•œ ìœ„ì¹˜ì¼ ë•Œ
    2. ì´ë™ëœ ìœ„ì¹˜ì—ì„œ ì •ì˜ë  ë•Œ

â†’ ë‘ ê²½ìš° ëª¨ë‘ M\mathbf{M}Mì€ body frameì„ world ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•¨

3) Affine Transformation Matrix Transforms a Point in Body Frame to (the same) Point (but) represented in World Frame

  • $ \mathbf{p}^{\{1\}} = \begin{bmatrix}1 \ 1 \ 0\end{bmatrix} $
    (body frame 1\\{1\\}1 ê¸°ì¤€ì˜ ì )

p0=Mâ‹…p1\mathbf{p}^{\\{0\\}} = \mathbf{M} \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\\{1\\}} p0=Mâ‹…p1

  • ê°™ì€ ì ì„ world frame 0\\{0\\}0 ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•œ ê²ƒ
    Why?
  • ë™ì¼í•œ ë¬¼ì²´ë¥¼ body frameì—ì„œ ë³´ë‹¤ê°€ M\mathbf{M}Mì„ í†µí•´ world frame ê¸°ì¤€ í‘œí˜„ìœ¼ë¡œ ë³€í™˜í•œ ê²ƒ:

p0=Mâ‹…p1\mathbf{p}^{\\{0\\}} = \mathbf{M} \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\\{1\\}} p0=Mâ‹…p1

  • ë‹¨ìˆœíˆ geometryë¥¼ ë³€í™˜í•œ ì´ì•¼ê¸°ì„

    • geometry ìì²´ë¥¼ transform (frameì€ ê·¸ëŒ€ë¡œ)

      â†’ p0\mathbf{p}^{\\{0\\}}p0ê°€ ë³€í™˜ë˜ì–´ p1\mathbf{p}^{\\{1\\}}p1ì´ ë¨.

Quiz 2

All these concepts work even if the starting frame is not world frame!

  • ì‹œì‘ í”„ë ˆì„ì´ world frameì´ ì•„ë‹ˆì–´ë„, ì§€ê¸ˆê¹Œì§€ì˜ ëª¨ë“  ê°œë…ì€ ê·¸ëŒ€ë¡œ ì ìš© ê°€ëŠ¥

{0} to {1}

  • M1\mathbf{M}_1M1â€‹ì€ ë‹¤ìŒì„ ìˆ˜í–‰:
    1. í”„ë ˆì„ {0}\{0\}{0} ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ geometryë¥¼ ë³€í™˜

      p{0}=M1â‹…p{1}\mathbf{p}^{\{0\}} = \mathbf{M}_1 \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\{1\}} p{0}=M1â€‹â‹…p{1}

{1} to {2}

  • M2\mathbf{M}_2M2â€‹ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒì„ ìˆ˜í–‰:

    3. í”„ë ˆì„ {2}\{2\}{2} ê¸°ì¤€ì˜ ì ì„ {1}\{1\}{1} ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„

      p{1}=M2â‹…p{2}\mathbf{p}^{\{1\}} = \mathbf{M}_2 \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\{2\}} p{1}=M2â€‹â‹…p{2}

{0} to {2}

  • M1M2\mathbf{M}_1 \mathbf{M}_2M1â€‹M2â€‹ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒì„ ìˆ˜í–‰:

    2. í”„ë ˆì„ {0}\{0\}{0} ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ í”„ë ˆì„ {2}\{2\}{2}ë¥¼ ì •ì˜
    3. í”„ë ˆì„ {2}\{2\}{2} ê¸°ì¤€ì˜ ì ì„ {0}\{0\}{0} ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„

      p{0}=M1â‹…M2â‹…p{2}\mathbf{p}^{\{0\}} = \mathbf{M}_1 \cdot \mathbf{M}_2 \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\{2\}} p{0}=M1â€‹â‹…M2â€‹â‹…p{2}

Revisit: Order Matters!

  • T,R\mathbf{T}, \mathbf{R}T,Rì´ affine transformationì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚´ëŠ” í–‰ë ¬ì¼ ë•Œ:

pâ€²=Tâ‹…Râ‹…p\mathbf{p}' = \mathbf{T} \cdot \mathbf{R} \cdot \mathbf{p} pâ€²=Tâ‹…Râ‹…p

ë¨¼ì € R(p)\mathbf{R}(\mathbf{p})R(p)ë¥¼ ì ìš©í•œ ë’¤, ê·¸ ê²°ê³¼ì— T\mathbf{T}Të¥¼ ì ìš©

Composite(ë³µí•©) Transformationsì˜ Interpretation(í•´ì„)

    M=T(x,Â 3)â‹…R(âˆ’90âˆ˜)\mathbf{M} = \mathbf{T}(x,~3) \cdot \mathbf{R}(-90^\circ) M=T(x,Â 3)â‹…R(âˆ’90âˆ˜)

pâ€²=M1â‹…M2â‹…p(pre-multiplicationÂ byÂ M1)\mathbf{p}' = \mathbf{M}_1 \cdot \mathbf{M}_2 \cdot \mathbf{p} \\ (\text{pre-multiplication by } \mathbf{M}_1) pâ€²=M1â€‹â‹…M2â€‹â‹…p(pre-multiplicationÂ byÂ M1â€‹)
